00011 UserStream::UserStream(const char* filename, bool load) : fp(NULL)
00012 {
00013         fp = fopen(filename, load ? "rb" : "wb");
00014 }
00015 
00016 UserStream::~UserStream()
00017 {
00018         if(fp)  fclose(fp);
00019 }

00021 // Loading API
00022 NxU8 UserStream::readByte() const
00023 {
00024         NxU8 b;
00025         size_t r = fread(&b, sizeof(NxU8), 1, fp);
00026         assert(r!=0);
00027         return b;
00028 }

00114 MemoryWriteBuffer::MemoryWriteBuffer() : currentSize(0), maxSize(0), data(NULL)

00123 NxStream& MemoryWriteBuffer::storeByte(NxU8 b)
00124 {
00125         storeBuffer(&b, sizeof(NxU8));
00126         return *this;
00127 }
00128 NxStream& MemoryWriteBuffer::storeWord(NxU16 w)

00131         return *this;
00132 }

00134 {
00135         storeBuffer(&d, sizeof(NxU32));
00136         return *this;

00138 NxStream& MemoryWriteBuffer::storeFloat(NxReal f)
00139 {
00140         storeBuffer(&f, sizeof(NxReal));
00141         return *this;

00143 NxStream& MemoryWriteBuffer::storeDouble(NxF64 f)

00145         storeBuffer(&f, sizeof(NxF64));
00146         return *this;

00148 NxStream& MemoryWriteBuffer::storeBuffer(const void* buffer, NxU32 size)
00149 {
00150         NxU32 expectedSize = currentSize + size;
00151         if(expectedSize > maxSize)
00152         {
00153                 maxSize = expectedSize + 4096;
00154 
00155                 NxU8* newData = (NxU8*)NX_ALLOC(maxSize);
00156                 if(data)
00157                 {
00158                         memcpy(newData, data, currentSize);
00159                         NX_FREE(data);
00160                 }
00161                 data = newData;
00162         }
00163         memcpy(data+currentSize, buffer, size);
00164         currentSize += size;
00165         return *this;
00166 }

00228 void PhysicsErrorStream::reportError(NxErrorCode e, const char * message, const char *file, int line)
00229 {
00230         //printf("%s (%d) :", file, line);
00231         switch (e)
00232         {
00233                 case NXE_INVALID_PARAMETER:
00234                         //printf( "invalid parameter");
00235                         break;
00236                 case NXE_INVALID_OPERATION:
00237                         //printf( "invalid operation");
00238                         break;
00239                 case NXE_OUT_OF_MEMORY:
00240                         //printf( "out of memory");
00241                         break;
00242                 case NXE_INTERNAL_ERROR:
00243                         //printf( "internal error");
00244                         break;
00245                 case NXE_ASSERTION:
00246                         break;
00247                 case NXE_DB_INFO:
00248                         //printf( "info");
00249                         break;
00250                 case NXE_DB_WARNING:
00251                         //printf( "warning");
00252                         break;
00253                 case NXE_DB_PRINT:
00254                         break;
00255                 default:
00256                         assert(false && "unknown error");
00257                         //printf("unknown error");
00258         }
00259 
00260         //printf(" : %s\n", message);
00261 }
00262 
00263 //
00264 // BaseGamePhysicsErrorStream::reportAssertViolation                            - Chapter 15, page 575
00265 //
00266 NxAssertResponse PhysicsErrorStream::reportAssertViolation(const char * message, const char *file, int line)
00267 {
00268         //printf("access violation : %s (%s line %d)\n", message, file, line);
00269         switch (MessageBoxA(0, message, "AssertViolation, see console for details.", MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE))      
00270         {
00271                 case IDRETRY:
00272                         return NX_AR_CONTINUE;
00273                 case IDIGNORE:
00274                         return NX_AR_IGNORE;
00275                 case IDABORT:
00276                 default:
00277                         return NX_AR_BREAKPOINT;
00278         }
00279 }
